metadata.title: Project Setup - CDK for Terraform
metadata.description: Build a CDKTF application from a template or existing HCL project, and configure storage for Terraform state.

outlineItems.title: Convert an HCL Project to a CDKTF TypeScript Project
Convert HCL Files to CDKTF Format

mdxSource.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={};const MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components,...props}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...props,components:components,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`There are several ways to create a new CDK for Terraform (CDKTF) project. You can create a new application from a pre-built or a custom template, and you can also convert an existing HCL project. When you create a new project, you can store Terraform state locally or use a `,mdx("a",{parentName:"p","href":"/terraform/cdktf/concepts/remote-backends"},`remote backend`),`. This page discusses these setup options in more detail.`),mdx("blockquote",null,mdx("p",{parentName:"blockquote"},mdx("strong",{parentName:"p"},`Hands On`),`: Try the `,mdx("a",{parentName:"p","href":"/terraform/tutorials/cdktf/cdktf-install"},`CDK for Terraform Quick Start Demo`),` and language-specific `,mdx("a",{parentName:"p","href":"/terraform/tutorials/cdktf"},`Get Started tutorials`),`.`)),mdx("h2",{"id":"initialize-project-from-a-template"},mdx("a",{parentName:"h2","className":"__permalink-h","href":"#initialize-project-from-a-template","aria-label":"initialize project from a template permalink"},`\xbb`),`Initialize Project from a Template`),mdx("p",null,`Use `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`init`),` with a project template to automatically create and scaffold a new CDKTF project for your chosen programming language.
Templates generate a new application with the necessary file structure for you to start defining infrastructure.`),mdx("p",null,`You can use a `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`cdktf-cli`),` pre-built template or a custom-built `,mdx("a",{parentName:"p","href":"/terraform/cdktf/create-and-deploy/remote-templates"},`remote template`),` when you initialize a new project.`),mdx("pre",{"className":"language-bash"},mdx("code",{parentName:"pre","className":"language-bash"},`$ cdktf init --template`,mdx("span",{parentName:"code","className":"token operator"},`=`),mdx("span",{parentName:"code","className":"token string"},`"templateName"`),`

For more information refer to the Java examples which also include Maven examples: `,mdx("a",{parentName:"p","href":"/terraform/cdktf/examples-and-guides/examples#java"},`Java Examples`),`.`),mdx("h3",{"id":"use-a-local-backend"},mdx("a",{parentName:"h3","className":"__permalink-h","href":"#use-a-local-backend","aria-label":"use a local backend permalink"},`\xbb`),`Use a Local Backend`),mdx("p",null,`Add the `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`--local`),` flag to created a scaffolded project that is pre-configured to use a `,mdx("a",{parentName:"p","href":"/terraform/language/settings/backends/local"},`local backend`),`. This means that your application stores `,mdx("a",{parentName:"p","href":"/terraform/language/state"},`Terraform state`),` on your local machine and all Terraform operations run locally.`),mdx("pre",null,mdx("code",{parentName:"pre"},`$ cdktf init --template="typescript" --local`,`
